papers.title: A Dynamic Survey of Soft Set Theory and Its Extensions
papers.description:
arXiv:2602.21268v1 Announce Type: new 
Abstract: Soft set theory provides a direct framework for parameterized decision modeling by assigning to each attribute (parameter) a subset of a given universe, thereby representing uncertainty in a structured way [1, 2]. Over the past decades, the theory has
papers.author: Takaaki Fujita, Florentin Smarandache

papers.title: A Hierarchical Multi-Agent System for Autonomous Discovery in Geoscientific Data Archives
papers.description:
arXiv:2602.21351v1 Announce Type: new 
Abstract: The rapid accumulation of Earth science data has created a significant scalability challenge; while repositories like PANGAEA host vast collections of datasets, citation metrics indicate that a substantial portion remains underutilized, limiting data
papers.author: Dmitrii Pantiukhin, Ivan Kuznetsov, Boris Shapkin, Antonia Anna Jost, Thomas Jung, Nikolay Koldunov

papers.title: Beyond Refusal: Probing the Limits of Agentic Self-Correction for Semantic Sensitive Information
papers.description:
arXiv:2602.21496v1 Announce Type: new 
Abstract: While defenses for structured PII are mature, Large Language Models (LLMs) pose a new threat: Semantic Sensitive Information (SemSI), where models infer sensitive identity attributes, generate reputation-harmful content, or hallucinate potentially wro
papers.author: Umid Suleymanov, Zaur Rajabov, Emil Mirzazada, Murat Kantarcioglu

papers.title: ARLArena: A Unified Framework for Stable Agentic Reinforcement Learning
papers.description:
arXiv:2602.21534v1 Announce Type: new 
Abstract: Agentic reinforcement learning (ARL) has rapidly gained attention as a promising paradigm for training agents to solve complex, multi-step interactive tasks. Despite encouraging early results, ARL remains highly unstable, often leading to training col
papers.author: Xiaoxuan Wang, Han Zhang, Haixin Wang, Yidan Shi, Ruoyan Li, Kaiqiao Han, Chenyi Tong, Haoran Deng, Renliang Sun, Alexander Taylor, Yanqiao Zhu, Jason Cong, Yizhou Sun, Wei Wang

papers.title: Power and Limitations of Aggregation in Compound AI Systems
papers.description:
arXiv:2602.21556v1 Announce Type: new 
Abstract: When designing compound AI systems, a common approach is to query multiple copies of the same model and aggregate the responses to produce a synthesized output. Given the homogeneity of these models, this raises the question of whether aggregation unl
papers.author: Nivasini Ananthakrishnan, Meena Jagadeesan

papers.title: The ASIR Courage Model: A Phase-Dynamic Framework for Truth Transitions in Human and AI Systems
papers.description:
arXiv:2602.21745v1 Announce Type: new 
Abstract: We introduce the ASIR (Awakened Shared Intelligence Relationship) Courage Model, a phase-dynamic framework that formalizes truth-disclosure as a state transition rather than a personality trait. The mode characterizes the shift from suppression (S0) t
papers.author: Hyo Jin Kim (Jinple)

papers.title: fEDM+: A Risk-Based Fuzzy Ethical Decision Making Framework with Principle-Level Explainability and Pluralistic Validation
papers.description:
arXiv:2602.21746v1 Announce Type: new 
Abstract: In a previous work, we introduced the fuzzy Ethical Decision-Making framework (fEDM), a risk-based ethical reasoning architecture grounded in fuzzy logic. The original model combined a fuzzy Ethical Risk Assessment module (fERA) with ethical decision
papers.author: Abeer Dyoub, Francesca A. Lisi

papers.title: Prompt Architecture Determines Reasoning Quality: A Variable Isolation Study on the Car Wash Problem
papers.description:
arXiv:2602.21814v1 Announce Type: new 
Abstract: Large language models consistently fail the "car wash problem," a viral reasoning benchmark requiring implicit physical constraint inference. We present a variable isolation study (n=20 per condition, 6 conditions, 120 total trials) examining which pr
papers.author: Heejin Jo

papers.title: Distill and Align Decomposition for Enhanced Claim Verification
papers.description:
arXiv:2602.21857v1 Announce Type: new 
Abstract: Complex claim verification requires decomposing sentences into verifiable subclaims, yet existing methods struggle to align decomposition quality with verification performance. We propose a reinforcement learning (RL) approach that jointly optimizes d
papers.author: Jabez Magomere, Elena Kochkina, Samuel Mensah, Simerjot Kaur, Fernando Acero, Arturo Oncevay, Charese H. Smiley, Xiaomo Liu, Manuela Veloso

papers.title: ProactiveMobile: A Comprehensive Benchmark for Boosting Proactive Intelligence on Mobile Devices
papers.description:
arXiv:2602.21858v1 Announce Type: new 
Abstract: Multimodal large language models (MLLMs) have made significant progress in mobile agent development, yet their capabilities are predominantly confined to a reactive paradigm, where they merely execute explicit user commands. The emerging paradigm of p
papers.author: Dezhi Kong, Zhengzhao Feng, Qiliang Liang, Hao Wang, Haofei Sun, Changpeng Yang, Yang Li, Peng Zhou, Shuai Nie, Hongzhen Wang, Linfeng Zhou, Hao Jia, Jiaming Xu, Runyu Shi, Ying Huang
